Events that occurred on 19 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1916 - Writer Terence Tiller is born.
1931 - J.R.R. Tolkien, C.S. Lewis and Hugo Dyson have dinner, followed by a conversation that ran until 4 a.m. the following morning that was essential for Lewis's conversion to Christianity.
1943 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49e.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 80a.
1956 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Terence Tiller.
1962 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Alina Dadlez.
1965 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 277a.
1982 - The article "The Return of Tolkien" is published in The Sunday Times Magazine.
1986 - Oxonmoot 1986 at Oxford Town Hall.
1993 - Oxonmoot 1993 at University College.
1997 - Oxonmoot 1997 at Exeter College.
2003 - Oxonmoot 2003 at St Hugh's College.
2004 - Oxonmoot 2004 at St Hilda's College.
2004 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony at Mortensen Hall in Hartford, Connecticut.
2020 - Oxonmoot 2020 held online due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf arrives at Edoras but is not allowed to enter.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
